column3:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#16370](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16370.html) (depends: cleanup package configure flags by
Fantastic! :relaxed: Could you add a comment detailing our rationale and include a link to the qt requirements page?
@dongcarl rebased and added a comment and Qt link to the commit body and `.mk` file.

tACK 3303124960d3d857d9ce29a88a589e00b1d0f8fa\n\nPerformed Guix build of 3303124960d3d857d9ce29a88a589e00b1d0f8fa (`fanquake/disable_xcb_extensions`) and fbe4b7665b971aec3cf7448309d59d2661e513bd (`git merge-base fanquake/disable_xcb_extensions origin/master`), found `sha256sum distsrc-*/installed/bitcoin-0.18.99/bin/bitcoin{d,-qt}*` to be identical.
How can they be identical when the git commit id is embedded into the binary? I guess guix does not embed it?

@MarcoFalke is https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/00dad5e0e1ddd6047bd4ff0a3032aa8950817b5f/contrib/gitian-descriptors/gitian-linux.yml#L156 what embeds it? I didn't know if this line was needed anymore so I removed it from the guix build script.

With the DrahtBot gitian results, i get:

```diff
$ diffoscope bitcoin-0.18.99_*/bin/bitcoind
--- bitcoin-0.18.99_m/bin/bitcoind
+++ bitcoin-0.18.99_p/bin/bitcoind
│┄ Command `objdump --line-numbers --disassemble --demangle --section=.init bitcoin-0.18.99_m/bin/bitcoind` exited with 1. Output:
│┄     objdump: can't disassemble for architecture UNKNOWN!
│┄
│┄     objdump: section

>  what embeds it? I didn't know if this line was needed anymore so I removed it from the guix build script.\n\nGood question. I don't really know. Also, it seems that for releases (i.e. our git tags), the commit id is not included.
Is the discussion about identical binaries a blocker for merging this? (I don't think so but ask just in case)

> Is the discussion about identical binaries a blocker for merging this? (I don't think so but ask just in case)\n\nNope, not at all. :relaxed: For reference, further discussion on this topic should probably now happen here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/16588
